captionText: In every walk with nature, one receives far more than he seeks.
author: John Muir

captionText: The Earth has music for those who listen.
author: George Santayana

captionText: Look deep into nature, and then you will understand everything better.
author: Albert Einstein

captionText: The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness.
author: John Muir

captionText: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
author: Lao Tzu

captionText: In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer.
author: Albert Camus

captionText: The poetry of the earth is never dead.
author: John Keats

captionText: Every flower is a soul blossoming in nature.
author: Gerard De Nerval

captionText: I felt my lungs inflate with the onrush of scenery—air, mountains, trees, people. I thought, 'This is what it is to be happy.'
author: Sylvia Plath

captionText: Study nature, love nature, stay close to nature. It will never fail you.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

captionText: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

captionText: To walk in nature is to witness a thousand miracles.
author: Mary Davis

captionText: Nature always wears the colors of the spirit.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

captionText: The mountains are calling, and I must go.
author: John Muir

captionText: To sit in the shade on a fine day and look upon the verdant green hills is the most perfect refreshment.
author: Jane Austen

captionText: Nature never did betray the heart that loved her.
author: William Wordsworth

captionText: The earth laughs in flowers.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

captionText: There is something infinitely healing in the repeated refrains of nature—the assurance that dawn comes after night, and spring after winter.
author: Rachel Carson

captionText: The sun does not shine for a few trees and flowers, but for the wide world's joy.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

captionText: I go to nature to be soothed and healed, and to have my senses put in order.
author: John Burroughs

captionText: I took a walk in the woods and came out taller than the trees.
author: Henry David Thoreau

captionText: To me, a lush carpet of pine needles or spongy grass is more welcome than the most luxurious Persian rug.
author: Helen Keller

captionText: Nature is not a place to visit. It is home.
author: Gary Snyder

captionText: If you truly love nature, you will find beauty everywhere.
author: Vincent van Gogh

captionText: In nature, nothing is perfect and everything is perfect. Trees can be contorted, bent in weird ways, and they're still beautiful.
author: Alice Walker

captionText: Those who contemplate the beauty of the earth find reserves of strength that will endure as long as life lasts.
author: Rachel Carson

captionText: The earth has its music for those who will listen.
author: George Santayana

captionText: Nature is not on the internet, and outdoor experiences will always surpass virtual reality.
author: Tim Fargo

captionText: When one tugs at a single thing in nature, he finds it attached to the rest of the world.
author: John Muir

captionText: In the woods, we return to reason and faith.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

captionText: The forest makes your heart gentle. You become one with it... No place for greed or anger there.
author: Pha Pachak

captionText: The richness I achieve comes from nature, the source of my inspiration.
author: Claude Monet

captionText: A forest bird never wants a cage.
author: Henrik Ibsen

captionText: In every walk in with nature one receives far more than he seeks.
author: John Muir

captionText: Nature always wears the colors of the spirit.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

captionText: To me, a lush carpet of pine needles or spongy grass is more welcome than the most luxurious Persian rug.
author: Helen Keller
